inn1.comm: bit of flight on middle stump, tucked straight to midwicket
hint of turn from off and middle, steered to midwicket again
down the leg side as van Wyk tries to paddle-swat that, called a wide
on the stumps again, worked past midwicket to get off the mark
lots of flight and some dip towards middle stump, helped to midwicket
defends the straight ball back to McCullum
on the pads, Amla gets off the mark by going back and steered it to deep midwicket for one
that's quick and so inaccurate - 150kph and short ball well down the leg side for a massive wide
pretty full and well outside off, it's steered without much footwork to third man for one
down the leg side again, with a short ball, another wide
superb delivery - this one at 133kph, came in with the angle and off the seam, van Wyk left confidently but that nearly knocked the off stump!
shapes this away now, pretty wide outside off, just inside the wide line
full and wide with some outswing, there's room and van Wyk cashes in by driving that through the covers by timing that nicely between cover and mid-off
wanted to leave that but couldn't withdraw his bat on time, gets an edge off the short ball to third man for one
back of length and outside off, Amla lets it go

he comes down the track first ball, takes it on the full and lofts it from just outside off, straight down the ground for a four to the long-off region. Umpires checking if the ball bounced inside or outside, replays confirm it landed just inside
shorter this time and some turn, van Wyk goes back and swats it to deep square leg for one
towards the stumps and Amla works it nicely with the turn to deep midwicket
touch short of length outside leg, he finds short fine leg with a sweep
nicely bowled outside off, there was flight, van Wyk tried to cut off the back foot and missed
tossed up outside off, he leans forward and blocks it back
shapes it away nicely from outside the off stump, Amla lets it go
just back of length outside off, Amla defends off the back foot towards cover point
bangs in the bouncer at 137.6kph, it's too short and called wide
short of length around off, Amla waits on the back foot and looked like he wanted to whip it to leg, but pushed it back
142kph, that's quick and just outside off, good bounce too off back of length and Amla nearly takes a hand off while defending it away from the body
143kph, teasing line outside off again, leaving Amla in two minds. He looked to leave it but was bit too late and got an edge to third man
143.6kph, angles it in towards the batsman, van Wyk is cramped for room and takes it on the pad
back of length from outside leg, Amla hops on the back foot and tucks it to midwicket
even shorter on the leg side, Amla jumps higher with hands in front of his face and succeeds in keeping the ball down on the leg side
he's peppering him with the short ones! Another one towards the batsman, goes on the toes again to defend it to leg
126.7kph, bangs it in short again, Amla stays on the side and sways out of the line this time
same length, bit of change in line towards off, Amla pulls and misses

gets the hang of it this time and gets six! MM erred with the line on the last ball, it was angling away from Amla outside off, he stayed back and went on his toes for the upper cut to direct it wide of third man
angled in towards the batsman, helped to the leg side behind square for one
146kph, accurate line and length outside off, Amla gets behind it and defends solidly with his head down
touch closer to the off stump, 147kph, Amla gets his bat down just in time and pushes it back to mid-on
143.5kph, superb delivery! Back of length outside off, bit of angle but the ball nearly holds its line as Amla pokes on the back foot and misses
too full outside off, but Amla can't clear point. It was driven nicely off the middle off the bat, but straight to the fielder
jabs it in a bit from outside off, Amla closes the face of the bat to get one to the leg side
just wide of the keeper, it was short again, Amla glanced and deflected it down the leg side off his thigh pad for four leg byes
another six for Amla, behind square again, but this time on the leg side! Short ball on the leg side, Amla middles it wide of deep fine leg with a hook
throws his bat at this one outside off, there was some room, and gets a single to third man
gets the outside edge, but it's just wide of second slip! Teasing line outside off with the angle, van Wyk pokes and edges but it flies just wide of the slips!
extra bounce surprises van Wyk on the leg side, it was from back of length, and he defended it towards midwicket
fullish and widish outside off, van Wyk pushes it back
back of length outside off, hardly any room and Amla defends it back
mixes it up with a quick yorker at 149.6kph on the off stump, don't think Amla expected that and luckily got the toe end of the bat to third man for one
150kph, short of length outside off, van Wyk leaves. Ronchi leaves it too, but it was an error and they get a bye
147.2kph, angles it in from back of length, Amla uses his supple wrists to help it to the leg side off the back foot
146kph, short of length again outside off, Amla looked to play but left it in the end
solid defence on the back foot in front of off stump for the short of length ball
139kph, nice line outside off with the angle, van Wyk leaves it
good bounce for this one outside off, touch short of length and left again
sightly wider outside off with the angle, left again

oh, what a change of strategy, gets van Wyk! MM bangs it in short outside off and it's coming in with the angle, that forces van Wyk to play even though he wants to leave. But he withdraws a bit too late and the ball goes off the edge to fly slip. Easy catch for McCullum
defends off the middle off the bat in front of off stump with his head down
slightly back of length outside off, RR watches it go to the keeper
pretty full outside off, Amla drives it down to mid-off
angled in a bit from off stump, it's back of length again and Amla gets time to whip it behind square on leg for one
slightly wide outside off with the angle, he lets it go
149kph, well outside off again, RR leans forward and leaves again
it's shorter, it's closer to the batsman, he almost plays but takes his bat out at the last moment as the ball moves away
145, bangs in the bouncer to end the over just outside off, RR sways out of the line and leaves
bit of a mix-up, not a big one as Amla tucks the back of length ball to midwicket off the back foot and wants one. But RR calls early and sends him back in time
too wide, too full and Amla frees his arms to drive that beautifully right between backward point and point with his wrists for four!
punched for four now, even better shot! It was short of length, he went on the back foot and punched that with a superb follow through, again between backward point and point
angles it in from outside off, back of length, and Amla leaves this time
goes across a bit to defend the ball to leg off the back foot but there's no time for a run
drives it, but not too powerfully, from outside off to mid-off
short of length around off stump, RR goes back to defend on off
leans forward a bit this time to defend the ball into the covers
fuller on the stumps, pushes it down solidly with a straight bat towards mid-off for one
fullish again outside off, Amla drives it down to mid-off off the front foot
back of length towards off stump with the angle, tucked to midwicket for one
bouncer to end the over on the leg side. Oh it's called a wide for height, one more to go then
on the pads, worked to fine leg easily for one and he keeps strike
turning from middle and leg towards leg, defends it back
futile appeal as it's going down leg, but he beats RR with the turn after it pitched on middle, and there was good bounce too
defends it back as it's tossed up and he covers his stumps
tight line, RR goes on the back foot to defend it in front of off stump
flighted on leg stump, RR waits and pushes it back to Sodhi
pitched up on middle stump, RR defends it back again. Good over as Sodhi starts with a maiden
leans towards the ball that's outside off and defends into the covers
full on off at 139kph, Amla drives it down the ground and Neesham gets a hand to it, trying to deflect it to the stumps but it goes towards midwicket
excellent adjustment from Amla as he goes back for the back of length ball and whips it to leg, but didn't time it that well and it landed just short of Elliott at square leg
shorter outside off, he tucks it with soft hands to leg for a quick single
nearly in the block hole well outside off, RR pushes it down towards mid-off
breaks the shackles by swatting the ball down to mid-off, KW dives to his left there but can't touch the ball
tight line on off stump, Amla defends on the off side
comes down as Sodhi pitches it shorter on leg, Amla adjusts and defends it to leg
goes back to let it turn outside off and steers it to deep cover for one
cuts this one off the back foot, it was well outside off, and just clears short third man for one
steers it late towards short third man this time, no run
much fuller on the pads, driven down with the turn to long-on for one
errs down the leg side past RR's pads, looks like it clipped the pad on the way
tries to drill it through the covers as it was pitched up, but doesn't time it well and finds mid-off
bizarre dismissal it was going to be - RR pulled, mistimed it completely, and got an inside edge onto his thigh pad and it lobbed off behind the stumps. But bounced just before the keeper
full outside off now, he drives it with the angle
almost down the leg side for a wide as RR leaves, but the short ball was just on the leg-stump line
angled in from back of length, RR turns a bit on the back foot and helps it to leg for one. Keeps strike, too
tossed up on middle stump, driven with the turn to midwicket
flighted on off stump, RR leans into it and pushes it to cover
fuller on off stump, drives it with the turn to long-on for one
falls short of Williamson at mid-on! Amla pulled the short ball, got an edge and it fell a yard or two short of mid-on, luckily for Amla
short ball well outside off, RR cuts off the back foot to deep point for one
flattish on middle stump, Amla defends it back to Sodhi
fullish length to begin after drinks, lovely line around off, patted back to the bowler off the back foot
just slightly short on middle, Rossouw picks the length very early and swats the pull but straight to deep square leg
sweet shot, with this outfield and Hashim's placement, he just needed to get it into the gap and that he did. Strayed on Amla's pads and that isn't very wise. Easily picked off through midwicket
length ball on off stump, Amla plays it back off the back foot
genuine edge. No slip though. Very streaky from Amla. Full and wide and Amla flayed at it and got a thick outside edge which flies past Ronchi. A first slip would have had him
short ball on middle this time, very easy pickings for Amla. He waits in his crease, rolls his wrists on it to keep it down and picks the gap behind square perfectly with the pull
fuller ball on off stump, not much spin. RR gets forward and defends off the front foot
ugly hoick. Very full on off stump, he gives himself room and tries to smash it down the ground but skews to midwicket
nicely played, drives with the spin to long-on off the front foot
brilliant use of the feet to throw off Sodhi's lengths. Nicely flighted outside off, Amla dances down the track and meets the ball as it pitches to drive through covers. Great shot
a bit too full this time. More flight from Sodhi. Amla squeezes it to cover
fuller on off stump, Amla skips down the track again and clips to midwicket
a bit too slow on middle, darted in very flat too. RR gets on the back foot and punches back to the bowler
slower again, 84 kph on middle, RR waits for the ball to turn before opening the face of the bat to guide with sift hands to third man
oh shot! Excellent shot selection. Dances down the track again, plays nicely with the spin to loft well over mid-off for a massve six
flighted outside off, driven to cover
drops short this time outside off. Amla rocks back quickly but finds point with the cut
short on off stump, too slow. RR rocks back early and cuts to sweeper
beaten on the outside edge. Slightly short outside off, Amla tries to cut but is beaten on bounce
advances down the track again to meet the flighted delivery, nicely driven to cover. Quick single easily made
nicely flighted on middle, no turn. RR plays to cover with the open face
much more air on off stump. Rossouw gets a giant front stride and blocks
use of the feet this time, gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery and drives with the turn down to long-on.
flatter on middle, worked off his pads to square leg
flat again outside off, Amla rocks back and punchily drives nicely with the spin to long-on
tossed up on off, patted to cover
nicely played once more. Against the turn too. Gets to the pitch of the ball and launches the flighted delivery well over long-on. Yet another six
fired in on leg, clipped to midwicket
darted in once more on middle and leg, RR gets back and plays it very late to third man. Could have played a better shot to that though.
whipped off his pads neatly and elegantly in the vacant midwicket region. A bit too full though from MM
wristily worked and dragged from a sixth stump line outside off to deep square leg. What a shot. Makes a scoring opportunity from nothing, there.
139 kph, full and just outside off, defended solidly off the front foot to cover
short this time, slightly wider outside off. RR chops on the ground to cover. Didn't find timing there
139 kph, full outside off, RR comes down the track and skews to mid-on but they run through for a quick single. Nicely run.
136 ks, good length outside off, cut nicely to point. Tried to open the face to find the gap but failed to execute
flat on middle, drifts on with the arm. RR waits and tucks to midwicket
fuller this time, same line, no spin. Driven back to the bowler
flight on leg, RR gets to the pitch of the ball and works to long-on. Didn't let that one spin
short outside off, Amla skews the ball back to the bowler

another magnificent shot! Just makes it look so easy. Skips down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball, watches the ball onto his bat as he smashes it over the bowler's head for a very safe boundary
worked with the spin to square leg from middle stump
crashed through the leg side. Steppin' it up here are these two. Short and wide outside off, RR picks the length very early and dispatches it through midwicket. Superlative timing
slightly uppishly driven. Fullish on off stump, RR stays in his crease and drives without feet movement
142 kph, full on middle and off, Roosouw drives to mid-on. Slightly rushed through the shot with the pace on that occasion
very, very high bouncer. Loops well over Rossouw's head
whistled through the off side this time. Advances down the track to beat the shorter length through cover, easily played.
change in pace, slower delivery at 122 kph on middle. Rossouw pats it back along the pitch harmlessly
yorker length outside off, Rossouw tries to whack it through the off side but the ball finds the inner half of his bat as it squirts out to mid-on
full slow ball on middle, 116 kph, Amla drives to long-on with no hassle whatsoever
110 ks, bowled from slightly wide outside off. Comes in with the angle forcing RR to defend watchfully
drifts in with the angle again on middle and leg, RR drives back to the bowler
makes a little bit of room to hit the length delivery to cover

almost taken. Was it dropped?  Hard chance. RR swats the slog-sweep in the air to deep square leg. Milne doesn't judge it well, makes a hard catch look harder and spills it very low. Not easy but should have been taken. It did carry
driven off the back foot
full delivery outside off, Amla drives nicely but finds cover
slightly short outside off, Amla ramps off the open face to point
gets back to his trademark wrist to open up the leg side. Bowled slightly wide outside off, Amla works it to long-on with exemplary use of the wrists
fullish on middle and off, worked to midwicket
whacks off the front foot to mid-off. RR advances down a couple of steps to meet the length delivery and flat-bats but finds the fielder
uppishly hit through cover. Full and wide, RR throws his hands at it and lofts on the bounce to the deep sweeper on the off side
short outside off, RR stays in his crease and pulls to deep square leg. Well timed
short and wide outside off, Amla wristily works to midwicket
bad ball. Release of the slight pressure that was building. Drifts well down leg, and with Ronchi standing up, he is unable to get to it either. Goes for five extras
turns the full delivery from outside off to long-on
115 ks, fullish length delivery on leg, RR drives to the bowler
unpleasant hoick again. Full on middle, RR tries to loft over midwicket but gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
short outside off, Amla finds point with his cut
122 kph, length delivery on middle, RR makes room and hits to cover, unable to find the gap though
length again and straight, Rossouw heaves off the front foot to mid-off
ooh, lazy and sloppy. Worked from outside off stump to midwicket, who misfields allowing them one
shorter outside off, better option for Rossouw to drive to long-on off the front foot
hits the fielder again. Slightly overpitched outside off, easily driven with the full face of the bat to cover
and again! Amla gets the full length delivery outside off but his drive finds cover.
what was that? Slow, short delivery and Rossouw gets under it after giving himself plenty of room. Ronchi is surprised too, they get extras
much much better batting. Picked his shot and more importantly, picked the right ball to execute. Fullish ball outside off, Rossouw gets under the length and lofts easily over mid-off
smashed off the back  foot to the swepeer cover
short and wide again, chopped to deep cover off the back foot
slower delivery on middle and leg, nicely driven to long-on
yorker on off stump. Good end to the over by Elliott. Amla defensively keeps it out
short length on off stump, worked to point off the front foot
108 kph, length delivery on middle, Rossouw gives himself room and smashes to cover. They are able to get a single though
oh well played. Opened the face of the bat to loft over cover. Full on off stump, Amla waits for the ball and deliberately plays it late and uppish.
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
dropped.  Another chance goes down. Full delivery outside off, Amla hits it uppishly once again but slightly wide of cover, Latham dives but is unable to hold onto a sharp chance high to his left.
96 kph, solidly defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, Amla skews the delivery off the inner half of the bat to midwicket. The pair get through for a quick single
flat-batted to the mid-on boundary. Rossouw gets to a gritty fifty. Slow but steady. Slightly short outside off, giving Rossouw the length to swat down the ground
and again. Doesn't get all of it this time, however. Similar lines and lengths, Rossouw flat-bats again but straight to the bowler
good change in length. Bangs it in halfway down outside off, Rossouw sways out of the line and lets it go
145 kph, slightly wider again outside off, easy scoring opportunity for Rossouw who cuts to the sweeper cover
wide called this time. Bouncer again, but straying down leg
beautiful drive. Short of a length on off stump. Amla stands tall and punchily drives to mid-off
shorter length on off, fired it in too. Rossouw hits to cover
short on middle again, Rossouw tries to hit through cover but gets a thick outside edge to short third man
fuller, flighted delivery on off stump, Rossouw slaps off the front foot to sweeper cover
slow short ball on middle, worked off his pads to deep square leg
thick outside edge but goes to the boundary this time. Slightly fuller on off stump, RR gets down and tries to slap through the off side but a thick edge earns him four
reverse-swept this time. Nicely executed behind square. The fielder gets around just in time, however and cuts it off.
superb timing again. Slightly fuller than a good length, Amla is quick on his toes and gets high to flick the delivery from off stump to deep square leg
short ball outside off with the angle, it's left alone
widish ball, just like the slip, and RR swishes at it to find deep cover
148kph, short ball just around the off stump, Amla goes on his toes to defend with soft hands
short again, coming in with the angle, Amla tucks it to leg for one
on length, it's a slower delivery well outside off, RR pushes it towards cover point
bit of turn around off stump, Amla goes back in the crease and defends
flatter one on off, Amla makes room and cuts it towards deep backward point for two
comes down this time to take it on the full and drives it handsomely into the gap, through the covers, to beat a diving long-off for four
flatter one on leg stump now, Amla tucks it to fine leg off the back foot
flat and quick on middle stump, RR makes room to cut but gets a bottom edge
comes down but Sodhi pitches it shorter, RR can only push it back to him
angling in from back of length and Amla works it wide of deep midwicket for two quick runs
this ball stops a bit and doesn't bounce as much as Amla waits on the back foot and then defends it back
fuller on middle and leg, clipped to leg but straight to midwicket
full and wide now, Amla drives late and finds backward point this time
fullish again outside off, driven nicely but straight to cover
towards the pads now and Amla easily works it away behind square on the leg side, in the gap for two
bit of flight on leg, RR unleashes the reverse-sweep and sends it wide of short third man in the gap for four
tries the same shot again, ball was fuller on off, but doesn't middle it this time
dances down to take it on the full and smashes it by opening up a little, the ball flies well over long-on for six!
it has disturbed Sodhi's length - full toss on leg and it's swept to fine leg for one
nice flight outside off, driven straight down to long-off for one
fullish outside off, RR finds short third man with his reverse sweep
back of length outside off, Amla cuts it late to third man for one
just over deep midwicket, six more! RR came down, Neesham pitched it short, RR replied with a pull from the middle of the bat and managed to clear a jumping Bracewell at the boundary
shortish again on leg and it's swatted to fine leg for one
defends the ball into the covers with soft hands for a quick one
too wide outside off, RR swings his bat to send that to deep cover for one
slower bouncer, looked like an offcutter, beats Amla as he tries to pull and misses
short ball angling in, pulled to deep square leg for one
clips the back of length ball off the back foot to deep square leg and that looked so effortless, but it has beaten deep midwicket to go for four
shuffles across a bit to tuck the ball from off to midwicket
pushes the ball from outside off just wide of cover for one
punches the short of length ball down to mid-off for one
steers the ball to leg off the back foot, it's just wide of midwicket and he makes it for the quick single to move to 99
on the pads and he tucks it easily to fine leg to bring up his 21st ODI hundred, another calm and brisk hundred from him, goes level with Gibbs
bouncer from Elliott towards leg, RR ducks and smiles
short ball, this is a loose one though and RR smashes it straight to deep midwicket
fullish on middle and off, pushed down to long-on for one
on length and RR heaves the ball to deep midwicket for one
guides the ball off the back foot towards square leg for one
takes a step down and helps the length delivery to midwicket for one
flighted well outside off, steered with the spin to leg for one more
shorter and flatter around off, Amla cuts it to backward point for one
fullish on the stumps, clipped down to long-on for one
around length on off, Amla makes room and steers the ball straight to point
full ad flighted outside off, driven nicely to deep cover for one
drills the full ball to cover and a good stop there, diving to his left to keep it to one
very confident appeal from McClenaghan as he nearly finds the block hole on leg stump, RR loses his balance and gets a leg bye. Excellent decision because it pitched outside leg
shortish outside off, Amla steers it in the air between point and cover for one
bangs in the short ball, RR pulls late to send it wide of deep fine leg for two

tries the yorker again, no need to appeal this time as the leg stump is uprooted. He's broken it actually! The angle might have made RR uncomfortable, cramping him for room, and he missed the yorker, and the ball got the bottom of leg stump
full and outside off, 139kph, driven easily to deep cover and he's off the mark
shortish around off, he cuts off the back foot to get one more
fuller on the stumps and Amla pushes it down to long-on for one
full and flighted outside off, driven to cover with the spin
on middle this time and AB sweeps it against the turn to deep backward square leg
draws the outside edge as Amla comes down and is beaten by the turn. Short third man dives to his left to save a few runs

goes through Ronchi's legs this time, no bowler wants to end his 10 overs like that. AB went for the sweep, the ball kept low and went through the keeper. Looks like there was a bottom edge, so four for AB
nearly in the block hole on middle and leg, Amla makes room and pushes to cover for one
short of length outside off and AB helps it late to third man for one
finds the gap with the ramp shot, one-bounce four! It was short and with the angle, Amla didn't use much power, just used the pace of the ball and beat third man
tries the yorker on the stumps, Amla pushes the low full toss down to long-off for one. MM tumbles in his follow through
top edge from AB, another short ball from MM. AB pulled and luckily for him the ball fell between fine leg and square leg
hammered to the leg side for four! Looks like Amla expected the short ball, he made room and dispatched it to the midwicket boundary with a powerful pull
touch short of length with some room outside off, AB cuts and misses

holes out to deep midwicket, AB is gone, I repeat, AB is gone! Milne pitched it short, AB pulled but didn't middle it again and it was an easy catch for Latham in the deep, even though he was a few yards in
full and just outside off, Amla manages some bat as he had aleready made room and gets one to third man
length delivery on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket to get off the mark
makes room for the full and wide delivery again, this time he middles it and steers the ball just over a leaping backward point for four

142kph, tries the block hole, gets the wicket and Amla gone too! It was pretty straight on the off stump, Amla opened up to find the gap on the off side but only got a thin edge, there was some reverse swing, before the ball knocked the bottom of middle stump
angled in from back of length, tucked towards midwicket for one
back of length outside off, pushed off the back foot wide of cover for one
some reverse-swing as it shapes in, Miller pushes it back to MM
swats the shorter ball to deep midwicket for one
finds the block hole around off and Behardien punches it over the bowler's head for one
sightly high full toss around off, pushed down to mid-off
starts with a bouncer towards leg stump, Behardien ducks and lets it go
opens up to drive that towards the covers but gets an inside edge to midwicket
another edge, this one at outside edge off Miller's bat as the ball angled away and had some reverse swing too. He stuck his bat outside off and got two to third man
tries the block hole outside off, Miller steers it past point for one
lucky top edge for Behardien, one-bounce four! He made room for the short ball, hooked and got a top edge to send that right over the keeper's head
middles this one and gets six! Made room again, Milne pitched it outside off and Behardien lofted that inside-out with a nice drive over the covers for maximum!
bowls a slow offcutter on the pads, Miller fails to put it away and takes it on the pad outside leg
that went really really high but fell safe, such luck for the South Africans today! Miller went hard at the full delivery outside off, it went towards deep point but fell right in the middle
there's some room, Miller drives away from the body and gets a very thick edge to send it flying between short third man and point for four!
it has disturbed Neesham's line, bowls a wide down leg
116kph, slow and short outside off, Miller pulls and misses
falls safe again, can you believe it! Miller got a top edge off the short ball, Guptill ran in from deep midwicket and put in a dive but it fell just short of him
short ball is a wide on the off side now
finally a catch has been taken, Miller falls too! There was room on off, it was an offcutter, Miller swished at it to find backward point
tries the inswinging yorker, it's a full toss and it's tucked to midwicket for one
back of length ball down the leg side, called wide
another full toss - this one is helped to fine leg for one
accurate yorker on middle stump, he makes room but can only block it back
nearly in the block hole outside off, steered off the back foot to deep cover
excellent effort at backward point - the batsman cut the ball on off, Neesham leapt high to his right to pluck it out with one hand
quick short ball hurries on to the batsman, he swats it down to long-on for one
last over begins with a six! It was pitched up towards the pads, Wiese hardly moved his feet and lofted it high enough to clear long-on
clears another fielder for six - this time behind square! Slow, short ball was on the leg side, he pivoted on the back foot to pull that and sent it just over deep fine leg
beaten this time, it was short again, Wiese pulled again but missed this time
bangs it in short again, Wiese fails to connect second time in a row but takes off successfully for a bye

keeps the short balls going, batsman misses and tries another bye but MM hits the stumps at bowler's end. Behardien also missed the pull, Wiese had already taken off for the single but Ronchi was quick enough to throw the ball to the bowler who did the rest

two in a two, McClenaghan finishes it off in style! Wiese went for the heave and got an inside edge onto his pad, the ball was close to the pitch on the leg side and MM quickly picked it up, turned around and shattered the stumps at the non-striker's end with a direct hit. Two sixes to start the over, two run outs to end it

inn2.comm: dropped first ball. Hmm, interesting start. Some gentle shape into the left-hander on middle and leg and Latham flicks in the air, very low to Behardien's left. Hard chance is spilled though
shortish delivery outside off, chopped into the ground towards point
beautiful shape. 134 kph moving away from the right-hander. Ronchi defensively prods at it and is beaten

dropped again. This should have been taken, though. Wow, what a start. Away movement to Ronchi again. Ronchi gets a thick outside edge which carries to Wiese at second slip, who comes forward and drops it
straighter on middle and leg, nicely clipped all along the ground, towards midwicket

gone this time, though. What a start this. Another gem of a delivery. In the corridor, moving away from Ronchi who can't do much with that other than poke at it. He gets a thick outside edge, and Amla at first slip takes a good, low catch. The umpires want to check if it has carried though. It has and he is gone
gentle full delivery to begin around off, Latham comes forward and drives to mid-off
136 ks, decent speeds, not much movement however. Drifting on middle and leg, Latham works off his pads to square leg
137 kph, slight away movement outside off. Latham gets a giant front stride and leaves
fuller length just outside off. Seeing if there is some movement on offer. Not much though and Latham is able to defend into the off side
similar lines and lengths. Fullish outside off, and a same result. Latham lets it go
130 kph, drifting on Latham's pads again who whips to square leg.
slightly straighter on middle, KW tucks neatly into the vacant square leg region. A 7-2 field and therefore plenty of gaps on the leg side. They run through for two
138.2 kph. Outside off at a fullish length and some away swing. KW leaves it be
very very wide outside off. Williamson flays at it but no connection, called wide

another genuine edge but all along the ground, played with very soft hands. Good delivery around off moving away, KW gets it through the gap at slip and gully for two. Good work at the third man boundary prevents the boundary
strays on Williamson's pads once more who has no trouble in glancing to fine leg

that has carried all the way, just uses the pace to help it all the way over the fine leg boundary. Shortish length on middle, Latham pulls in the air and the ball flies over the boundary for the first boundary of the innings.
changes his line, goes wider outside off and full. Latham shoulders arms
128 ks, lovely lines around off. Very different pace though. KW gets behind the line of the ball to defend
slight in swing this time. Pitched on a good length around off which comes back in to Williamson who watchfully defends
excellently played right under his eyes. Watches the ball come back in from a fullish length outside off and watchfully defends into the off side
again well played. Good bowling too. Nice lines around off, Williamson watchfully and elegantly blocks
135.4 kph, slightly shorter but good lines just outside off - fourth-stump line. Guided into the off side off the back foot
good length on off stump, Williamson getsa thick outside edge which goes to third man all along the ground
fuller outside off, angling away from KW who lets the ball come to him before guiding wide of gully towards third man for two. Well played
133 kph, full delivery outside off. Lots of away swing. Williamson watches it go by as he leaves
immediately corrects his line. Great lines. Amazing bowling. Very tight on the fourth-stump line on a good length. Williamson pats it to gully
invites the drive but Williamson says, "No, thanks." Full delivery angling away outside off. Williamson leaves
test match lines and lengths. Very testing for Williamson who is handling himself commendably. Good length outside off, Williamson leaves again watchfully. This is some contest

146 kph, finally forces Williamson to play a shot and he does and is beaten too. Really absorbing start this. Williamson fishes at it but he picked the ball to hit. Slightly shorter and some width too
full again and straight. Not much shape from Philander though, interestingly. Latham blocks back to the bowler
pushed wider outside off. Latham shuffles across and steers to point off the front foot
good length on off stump. Latham is behind the line of the ball nicely  to block
134 kph, slightly fuller, but nagging lines. Latham defends back to the bowler
shuffles across the off stump again to meet the fuller length and defend to cover. Really probing stuff from Philander
oh nice shot, well played too. Lets the fullish length comes to him and punchily drives past mid-off. Whistles across to the boundary

short outside off. Williamson tries to pull through the leg side and hits it nicely but to mid-on where AB de Villiers is lurking, picks up and throws in one swift motion to almost find Latham short at the non-strikers end
pushed wider outside off, Williamson mistimes the cut to cover
143,3 kph, fifth-stump line at a fuller length, Williamson watches the ball under his eyes as he keeps it out of the back foot
angled wider outside off. Williamson is not interested in driving. Leaves it be watchfully
140 kph, misses the length this time finally does Steyn. Full toss on leg stump, KW clips nicely to mid-on, de Villiers is there again, who unfurls a quick throw
angling across the left-hander. Latham is happy to let it go through to the keeper
136 ks, shorter length. In fact, a bouncer outside off. Williamson is good enough to sway out of the line and let it go
short of a length on of stump. Williamson tries to punch down the ground off the back foot but finds the bowler
a little shuffle outside off, similar to Amla's. But the line is good, well outside off on a good length. Williamson drives to cover
bounder down the leg side, Williamson looks to pull but misses.
140 kph, short on off stump, Williamson defends into the leg side with the slight inswing
good delivery again, nagging lines and lengths outside off. KW is over to the off side to make some opportunities but can only punch into the off side
he has got a hold of that, alright. Short on middle and leg, KW is quick on the length and pulls in the air but well over the square leg boundary. Nicely played and good shot selection
full and wide to begin, Latham squirts to third man off his drive.
short of a length on middle and leg, Williamson nudges to square leg.
good length outside off. 132 kph. Williamson stays in his crease and punches to cover with minimal foot movement
nicely played. KW's trademark get-off strike shot. Lets the length delivery come to him before guiding to third man off the back foot. Plays it very late.
tight lines around off. Latham defends into the off side
short ball on middle, doesn't get up high enough. Latham gets high on his toes and watchfully blocks
beaten on the outside edge. That is a surprise. Good line outside off. Williamson prods at it but is beaten
good length outside off again. Probing stuff from SA's bowlers. Williamson punchily drives to cover
132.5 kph, no movement there. Fuller than a good length, Williamson drives nicely to mid-off
nicely steered, his preferred stroke. Full outside off again, KW lets the ball come to him before opening the face of the bat to guide to third man
short of a length on middle and off, Latham stays on the back foot and pushes to midwicket region
good lines around off, Latham decides to let it go outside off
forces Rabada to bring the ball straighter and Williamson works off his pads to deep square leg
quick short bouncer, hustles Latham for pace who is late on the pull
poor lines finally. Drifting on Latham's pads who fails to tickle it down to fine leg. his thigh pad does the job, though. Gets it down to the fine leg boundary
inside edge past the stumps. Full length outside off, Latham drives at it but gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg. The lack pf pace allows them to come back for two
wider outside off once more, Latham drives again and squeezes it past backward point. By the time, Philander gets around from third man, they run back for two
very wide down the leg side. Called too. Rabada has lost his lines in this over
full outside off, Latham drives to cover who misfields, but de Villiers is quick on it preventing the single
low full toss to begin on middle, Williamson drives to long-on with no fuss
flatter on middle and off, Latham blocks back
googly outside off, Latham gets forward and opens the face of the bat to guide to cover for one
slightly short on off, Williamson drives to cover off the back foot
drifts on with the arm, not much spin. Just enough to beat Williamson's sweep. Big appeal, but not given. Going well down the off side
flight on middle and off, driven to midwicket
short and wide outside off, Latham cuts nicely but straight to point
very straight and full, Latham gets on the front foot and pushes to mid-off
creamed through the off side, there is a shot to admire. Slightly short outside off, Latham has enough width though and crashes it through cover region.
140 kph, short and wide again. Latham cuts through sweeper again nicely but the fielder is deep now
shorter on middle and leg, just the ball KW would have wanted but he misses the flick. He is struck high on the thigh pad
shuffles well outside off but Rabada improvises well and pushes wider outside off. Williamson watchfully pats into the off side
full on off stump, watchfully blocked back to the bowler
gets down nicely and paddles sweep fine. There is no fielder at 45 degrees which gives the batsmen two
goes down again to sweep but misses this time. He is struck very wide outside off. More van Wyk has gone down the leg side predicting the shot
and again. The repeat button has been pressed. But this time the ball hist him on the hand instead of the pads
low full toss on middle, heaved to long-on
almost got 'im. Beautifully flighted outside off but KW doesn't pick the googly. He tries to go inside out over cover but skews it just wide of de Villiers at midwicket. Hmm.
full and wide first up, creamed off the front foot to the sweeper on the off side
seam-up so far from Wiese. Fullish on off, whipped to mid-on off the front foot
nicely drifting in on leg stump with the angle but an easy option for KW who flicks to deep square leg
lovely shot. Real quality on show there. Very full outside off, Latham shuffles across and advances a touch too and drives the delivery easily through mid-off
picks it off his pads this time behind square. Chose the gap nicely and they get two more.
127kph, shortish on a fourth-stump line, steered to point off the back foot
flighted on middle, Williamson advances to covert it into a yorker and tucks to midwicket
darted in outside off, squeezed out to cover
flat again on off and middle, watchfully blocked back to the bowler
oh supreme shot selection. Gets down early and paddle-sweeps very fine. There is no one there and with the speed of the outfield, there is an easy boundary option. Great batting
fuller on off stump, another squeeze to fine leg. Mistimes the exuberant drive once more
clips off the front foot to long-on with the turn
short on middle and off, seam up, not much pace. Latham easily clips into the leg side off the front foot. No trouble whatsoever
127 kph, guided off the front foot to third man. Gully makes a half-stop but they still get one
the offcutter this time on middle and leg, Latham skips down the track and flicks but misses and is hit on the thigh pad.
another brilliant piece of shot selection. Comes down the track and flat-bats the pull well over mid-on.
slower offcutter outside off, I don't suppose KW will have much trouble with those. Easily steers to third man
good length delivery on off stump, patted into the off side with soft hands, they run through for one but an unnecessary throw gives them an extra run.
impeccable timing. Full on middle and leg, is there a hint of in swing or reverse, maybe not. But KW tucks into the leg side uppishly through square leg
throws his hands at the full wide delivery. Goes well over point. Rabada at third man runs around and make a good diving stop.
144.5 kph, full outside off. Latham blocks to cover
inside edge again, fortuitous for Latham. Full and wide and another thick inside edge misses the stumps as it rolls to fine leg. Easy two.
thick outside edge gets Latham four. Another streaky shot but brings rich dividends. Very wide outside off, Latham flays at the ball once more and the thick edge goes to the third man boundary
141 kph, better lines just around off. Latham confidently drives into the off side
poor ball once more, easy runs again fro KW. Strays on Williamson's pads who easily flicks off his pads down to the fine leg boundary
slower offcutter, opens the face of the bat and guides to third man for yet another single in that area
short of a length outside off, ramped off the face of the bat to third man. Another single
Williamson gives himself room and flat-bats to cover this time.
just a touch short on off and this man Williamson is quick on the length again and whacks the nothing delivery over midwicket. Yet another boundary
bouncer on off stump. Williamson waist for the ball to come to him and then rolls the wrists on it to keep it down to square leg. Very easy stuff
drifting in with the angle, good ball by Steyn. But Williamson is good enough to tuck to the right of mid-on. De Villiers hits the stumps at the non-strikers end but Williamson is easily in
uppishly driven through cover. Very wide outside off, and Latham smashes to sweeper cover
well bowled. Full on off stump. Properly defended back to the bowler
in swing again on off stump, just a touch. Williamson gets behind and blocks nicely into the off side
coming in with the angle again on off stump. Good over this. Williamson nurdles to midwicket off the front foot
full yorker on middle, tucked to midwicket
flat on the pads, tucked away easily to deep square leg for one
flat again on the pads, clipped away behind square for one more
bit of turn from middle and leg, helped with the spin to midwicket for one
flighted this time on middle, worked to midwicket off the front foot
comes down the track to take it on the full and chips it back uppishly
starts off with a wide delivery outside off, angles away further
square-drives this one with the angle past point for one and that's a well-constructed fifty for Latham
bit of room outside off and he guides it to third man for one
short of length outside off, Latham lets it go
tighter delivery, Latham leans forward and defends solidly on the off side
swings tentatively and misses this time, there was more room, he poked and was beaten
another swing and a miss, no footwork to chase that wider delivery. Went under the bat this time
flighted full toss on off, mistimes the drive to cover

KW's gone, handed a catch to cover! He danced down the track after missing out on the full toss, timed the shot very well by taking it on the full, unleashed an inside-out drive but could not strike it over Elgar, who had to jump just a bit to grab it over his head with both hands
full and flighted outside off, driven into the covers nicely along the ground
turns in the googly from just outside off, looks like he picked it and covered his stumps to defend it
full again outside off, driven down easily to long-off
turns it into the batsman, it's flat, and Latham defends it back
back of length delivery angles in, Guptill glances it fine and deflects it off his pad for four leg byes
this time it's a wide down the leg side, Guptill doesn't bother
nearly gets an inside edge onto his stumps! He leaned forward for the back of length delivery that seamed in after pitching, almost found the gate but got some bat before bouncing over the stumps
and another one down leg from Rabada, not given a wide though
dropped at slip! It was a tough catch, dipping on Wiese at slip, after Guptill poked outside off for the ball that somewhat held its line. Wiese dived to his right but couldn't get his hands under it
bangs in the bouncer over the batsman's head as he ducks under it
leans towards the ball outside off and defends it towards point. Better delivery from Rabada
short of length on middle and leg, Latham waits on the back foot and defends to point
full outside off, driven down with the turn to long-off
no room outside off, Latham prods forward and defends
finds backward point this time with a back-foot cut, Tahir applauds the fielder's diving effort
that's in the air, taken? No, it falls short! Latham pulled the googly against the turn to deep midwicket. The fielder charged in but it fell just short
pushes the length delivery into the covers for a quick one
pitched up, Guptill clears his front foot a bit and lofts it straight down the ground, it just beats long-on for a six
fullish outside off, driven nicely to deep cover for one
swing and a miss! There was some room outside off, Guptill went or it with a big swing but was beaten
pushes the fuller delivery to cover point, no room this time
towards the pads now, clipped away behind square on leg for one
strikes him right in front of leg stump, Rabada turned to appeal but it's a no ball for overstepping
mistimes the pull off the short ball to deep square leg for one
angling in from length, driven to the leg side and they sneak in a single
on length outside off, Guptill defends into the covers
slices this one over the covers for one off the front foot
slams the delivery down the ground to mid-off, where a fumble makes it easier for the quick single
defends the ball to cover with soft hands for another quick one
stays back and clips the ball from middle and leg to long-on for one
length ball on off, pushed down to long-on for one
full delivery with some room, Guptill drills it down and along the ground off the front foot, beats mid-off for a cracking four
jabs this one in from outside off, Guptill stays back and defends to point
slammed through the covers now! Too full, even more room than the first ball and he crunches it between mid-off and cover for four more
nicely bowled, slower one on off stump, pushed down to long-on for one
full and wide outside off, driven nicely and easily to deep cover for one

Wiese has turned it around on debut, takes the wicket of Guptill after two fours! It was a slower offcutter, pretty full around off and the batsman lofted it down, probably seeing the length, but only found the safe hands of Miller at long-on. He was a few yards inside the boundary
towards middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
in the block hole outside off, he pokes and misses
full and wide now, he drives off the front foot to deep cover for two
errs on the leg side and it's tucked fine past the keeper for two leg byes
angling away from outside off, he cuts it late to backward point
pretty full outside off, Latham drives off the front foot to mid-off
seams the ball away from length outside off and beats the bat by a few inches
too full now outside off, Elliott leans into it and drives that handsomely through the covers for a beautiful four

the slip comes in action, takes a good catch and that's the big wicket of Elliott! It was a touch back of length outside off, there was good bounce as Elliott looked to guide it to third man but only found Miller. They check for the no ball and there's some part of the heel behind the line
nearly gets another one as it's pitched up on leg, just some inside edge onto the pad before taking the single
tries it against Latham too but it's a wide down the leg side

another one, Philander removes the well-set Latham! The batsman shuffled across a bit, Philander pitched it on length on middle and the ball was nipping in, struck him right in front of the stumps and the finger went up, looked plumb
shapes it in towards middle stump, he defends it back solidly
flat and turning in, tucked to midwicket off the back foot
googly on length outside off, driven off the front foot to cover
comes down and is beaten, would have been stumped if he didn't get an inside edge onto his pads
goes back to let the ball turn and helps it behind square
bit slower through the air on middle, goes off a thick inside edge towards square leg for one
googly outside off and turning away further, left alone
short ball on leg, pulled to fine leg off the back foot for one
jabs it in a bit from middle stump, Neesham defends it towards midwicket
angled outside off now, Neesham chases without footwork and misses
back of length on the off stump, he defends off the back foot to point
jabs it in towards the pads, he's cramped up for room and can't connect with the bat
shapes it in again, worked to deep midwicket in the nick of time for one
takes a step down and drives the ball to long-off for one
flat and too full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on now
nicely flighted on off now, pushed back to the bowler
flat now on leg stump, helped to backward square leg
keeps a bit low as he goes back in the crease and manages some bat to tuck it to backward square leg
gets a googly well outside off Neesham punches that off the back foot, past cover for a much-needed four
tight line on the off stump, Munro defends into the covers
back of length on leg now, whipped to fine leg for one
falls just wide of AB! Munro chipped the length delivery with an edge into the covers, AB ran to his right, dived to his right but it was out of his reach
sends a bouncer down leg, called a wide
back of length outside off, pushes it towards point for one
whips this one off the pads, not a great line, and Steyn chases from fine leg but misfields as it goes through his legs
superb shot! There was room on off side now, he got a chance to free his arms and did exactly that by driving it nicely through the covers, all along the ground for four
on the pads and it's clipped to backward square leg for one
touch shorter on the pads, was a slow offcutter, and he tucked it behind square again on leg
too short outside off, Neesham waits on the back foot and slams it down to long on for one
on length on the stumps, he drives it down to long-off for one
puts his front foot across to whip it to leg, gets a risky inside edge to short fine leg
right in the block hole on middle, he blocks it on the off side
angled across the left-hander and full outside off, Munro sweetly times his drive to mid-off
just a tad too full again, wide outside off and Munro enjoys the width as he drives through cover to the sweeper
a bit too short this time outside off, Neesham badly mistimes the cut to cover
huge appeal, but not given.  Shorter length on middle and off, Neesham tries to pull but misses it altogether. Clips the trouser on the way to the keeper. Good decision by the umpire.
fuller and wider, Neesham hits it past cover to mid-off
sweet timing once more with the drive. Steyn switches to around the stumps for the last ball, angles the full delivery towards off stump. Munro gets a good forward stride and pushes wide of cover.
nicely bowled first up by Rabada. Fuller than a good length on off stump, Munro gets a thick outside edge which flies all along the ground to third man
a tad shorter outside off, Neesham punchily drives to sweeper off the back foot after standing up tall in his crease
short length just outside off. good lines these. Munro steers to point once again with hardly any feet movement
very short bouncer, flies well over the batsman's head and therefore called wide. Morne van Wyk was surprised with the call though
length delivery on off and middle, good lines once more. Munro can only push to mid-off off the front foot
140.7 kph, length again on and around off. Chopped back into the ground off the front foot
short once more on off stump. Excellent lines that over. defended back to the bowler off the back foot
144 kph, and hit back even quicker. What a shot that was. Full on a fourth-stump line and Neesham belts it past Steyn and the stumps to the boundary.
wonderful comeback. 140 kph, Quick bouncer and excellently directed too. Neesham hustles to get under it.

dropped on the fine leg boundary. Rabada has made a mess of that. Never looked like taking that. Huge let off. Short ball on off stump, Neesham is quick to pull but gets a thick leading edge which flies to fine leg. Misjudged it totally. Could be a huge moment in the game.
excellent short ball once more. Very well directed which is the important part. Neesham tries to pull again but is beaten for pace.
hits the deck hard once more. Not as short but lands it shorter than a good length, Neesham gets back quickly to defend into the off side
136 kph, but an ineffective low full toss outside off which is swatted away through midwicket and mid-on for a boundary.
nips back in just a little which beats Munro on the inside edge. Munro is hit high on the leg which rolls away to third man
fuller on middle and leg stump, Neesham gets the tihick inside half of his bat which goes in the gap behind square for four
and another boundary. Fullish on leg again, easy pickings for Neesham who gets forward and skews the heave through midwicket for four more.
length on middle and off, not a great line once more. Neesham defends back to the bowler
over-steps and goes to the boundary too. Poor stuff from Rabada. Very full on off stump, Neesham crashes it past the bowler and wide of mid-on for four
full and wide outside off, driven to cover off the back foot with no feet movement
length delivery outside off, slapped back to the bowler
slower bouncer outside off, 118 ks. Neesham rolls his wrists on it and keeps it on the ground behind square
137 ks, that kept low. Good length outside off, which goes under Neesham's bat. Van Wyk can't stop the bye
a thick outside edge again, flies in the air through fourth slip region. Tahir does well at third man
short and wide, cut away to the boundary. Poor bowling from South Africa here. Easy pickings for Munro, he flays his hands at it and lofts over point
very short bouncer again on off stump, not very pacey. But Munro gets under it.
poor ball again, slower offcutter on leg stump. Munro helps it along behind square. Behardien does well to keep them down to one
slower offcutter outside off, driven out to the sweeper off the front foot
slower delivery yet again on off stump, Neesham drives to mid-off and immediately sets off for one
short and wide this time, Munro crashes the cut to the sweeper

gone, what a massive wicket for SA. Neesham is gone. Wiese does the trick. Very clever slower bouncer on off stump, Neesham is through the shot much too early and gets a thick top edge which is joyously accepted by van Wyk. Cannot stress the importance of that wicket enough with respect to the match.
quick rising ball from a good length on off stuump. Excellently bowled. McCullum keeps it out with a defense
dropped again.  Wiese has had a terrible day while fielding. Slower ball on off stump and McCullum drills it back to Wiese who shells an extremely hard catch. Did not stick though.
poor bowling again, short on leg stump. Munro just had to help it along its way and he does exactly that. Doesn't bother keeping it down and flies over fine leg's head
better comeback. Fuller around off. Munro defends with intent to cover
and a repeat. Fullish outside off, blocked back to cover
132 ks, fullish length once more but straighter - on middle and leg. Munro whips to mid-on
length delivery outside off, lovely lines those. McCullum steers to point off the back foot. No run there

just out of reach.  Lands safe. Good short ball - chest-high to McCullum who pulls very awkwardly to square leg. De Villiers runs like a sprinter from mid-on but just cannot get there. Great effort though.
121.7 kph, fuller than a good length on off and middle stump, pushed to cover
98 kph, another slower offcutter outside off, McCullum thinks of pulling but abandons the stroke very late. Just inside the wide line
127 kph, seam-up delivery on off stump. McCullum drives nicely wide of cover to mid-off.
slower offcutter once more, 116 kph, poor line though well down leg. Munro cannot find bat on the flick.
122 kph, that's another boundary. Runs leaking here. McCullum cuts very nicely wide of point for four. Waits for the short ball to sit up before unleashing the cut

oh, almost. De Villiers at it again. Almost pulls off a stunning run out. Full on middle, clipped to the left of midwicket. De Villiers runs across, dives, field and under-arms the flick. Just misses the stumps. Munro was well short. May have hit the stump mic there, it was that close

98 kph, get him this time. Another massive wicket. Wonderful bowling. Tahir flights the ball with no spin which dips very late on Munro and importantly, it is straight. Munro decides to reverse sweep or switch hit. He misses it altogether and is absolutely plumb. Easy decision for the umpire
googly this time on leg stump, Milne gets struck high on the thigh pad
flight outside off, Milne rives nicely to long-off
flight again on middle and leg, McCullum gets down early and plays the fine paddle-sweep
thick inside edge past the stumps, the ball rolls to fine leg
flight outside off, McCullum throws his hands at it and uppishly skews the drive on the bounce to deep sweeper
clipped to midwicket off the stumps. The fielder is quick on it once more and throws but it is inaccurate
easy single, should not be there. Milne just taps the ball to point and sets off for a quick single
low full toss on leg stump, driven down the ground to long-on
full and slightly wide outside off, Milne goes after it but misses
fuller once more, in fact a low full toss, squirted off to deep square leg

what a catch Behardien. Stunning catch in the deep. Scintillating stuff. Short ball on middle and off stump, McCullum goes for the pull and executes half-decently. McCullum doesn't bother keeping it down though. Behardien runs around from square leg towards fine leg and completes a really really good catch.
googly first up, outside off. McClenaghan has no idea and is beaten by miles
yorker on middle, drilled back to the bowler
fuller googly again outside off, MM swats it off the front foot to long-on
almost through him. The skiddy delivery with no turn, Milne goes back and tries to cut but just about gets some bat on it
skiddy delivery once more, clips the pads and rolls away to fine leg
googly again, van Wyk doesn't pick it either. MM misses his sweep and luckily too because he earned his side four extras
another boundary. Slower offcutter on middle and leg, Milne helps it along it s way past short fine leg for another boundary
quick delivery this time, Milne swats to long-on with no timing. Just enough to get two though
shorter offcutter on off stump. Bouncer. Pulled off the front foot to deep square leg
slower offcutter once more and cracked away off the front foot way over deep midwicket. Massive six. Interesting times.
lower full toss, mistimed off the front foot towards mid-off
banged in halfway down the track again, heaved away to the right of de Villiers at long-on. They come back for two
angled across the heaving bat of MM. McClenaghan moves across but misses the slog
excellent yorker but NZ get two. Inside-edged just past the stumps. Runs down towards fine leg. But they scamper through for two.
in the hitting arc again. But outside off, MM misses the slog-heave again

low full toss outside off, slogged to deep midwicket where they decide to come back for a suicidal second run. The throw is slightly wide and van Wyk collects cleanly but fails to hit the stumps. Should have been out
and some more runs. Dale Steyn goes short, bouncer on middle and leg. MM gets a little bat of glove on it which agonisingly lobs over Morne van Wky for four more.

gone this time. Cleaned him up. Cross seamed delivery on off stump on a fuller length, MM makes room to try and drive over cover. But misses. The off stump is broken and NZ are 9 down. Very interesting shot.

gone, it is all over. Very very interesting cricket from NZ. Milne drills past the bowler and they run through for one. But NZ's batsmen aren't satisfied with just the one though. The mid-off fielder is quick to his right to keep it in and gets in a quick throw to Rabada. Just a slight misfield from Philander at mid-off and Sodhi comes back for two. He is well short though and that means South Africa take a 1-0 lead in the series.
